docs.title: NaN Gogh's Guide to the UltraBroken
docs.text: Welcome to the comprehensive guide on UltraBroken, the most broken glitch in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. This is a revered gem among all glitches—a true holy grail and a developer oversight!

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• UltraBroken Basics - Learn what UltraBroken is and how to trigger it
  • Effects - Explore all known UltraBroken effects
  • Zonai Device Hacks - Individual device breakdowns
  • Builds & UltraFuses - Creative constructions and combinations
  • Meta & Tips - Advanced strategies and guidance
  • Credits - Thanks to all contributors

docs.title: What is UltraBroken?
docs.text: UltraBroken unleashes a multitude of effects on the game, enhancing the already stellar gameplay and ultimately leading to the discovery of UltraFuses. However, it's important to note that this glitch only works on game versions prior to 1.2 and comes with its own set of sacrifices.

docs.title: Key Warning
docs.text: DO NOT HARD SAVE after performing UltraBroken! There are ways to transfer your objects back in time (ZLOT, Zuggle), so preserve your work properly.

docs.title: The Basics
docs.text:
1. Meet Zorona and Kairo at Riverside Stable (The Riverside Trolls)
  2. Place an object you can stand on using Ultrahand
  3. Step on the object
  4. Talk to one of the NPCs
  5. Finish the dialogue and let the cutscene run
  6. The object becomes UltraBroken!

Explore the sections above to dive deeper into this ocean of madness.

docs.title: Glued UltraBroken vs Glue-Free UltraBroken
docs.text: These two setup types have different capabilities and constraints:

docs.title: Glued UltraBroken
docs.text:
• Can use most effects
  • Cannot be used directly in UltraFuses
  • Requires glued objects in the setup

docs.title: Glue-Free UltraBroken
docs.text:
• Fusable - Can be fused to weapons/shields
  • Phantom Glue capable - Can create Phantom Glue connections
  • Sometimes needs Antimass - Multiple objects may require Antimass for effects to work

docs.title: Arrangement (Poltergeist Prevention)
docs.text: Proper object arrangement is critical for preventing unwanted interactions and maintaining control over Spooky Interactions.

docs.title: Best Equipment Types for UltraFuses
docs.text: When planning UltraFuses: - Not burnable - Avoid wooden equipment to prevent fuel fusion issues - Not metal - Avoid metallic equipment to prevent interference with electrical devices - Durability-friendly - Consider equipment that benefits from Consistency effects

docs.title: DO NOT HARD SAVE AFTER ULTRABROKEN!
docs.text:
There are means to transfer objects back in time: - ZLOT - Time-based object transfer - Zuggle - Alternative object preservation method

Always use these methods to preserve your UltraBroken equipment before closing the game.

docs.title: Terminology Quick Reference
docs.text:
• Spooky Interaction - Any interaction involving Ghost Glue or Phantom Glue
  • Ghost Glue - Attraction-based connections without Ultrahand Glue
  • Phantom Glue - Attraction + Ultrahand Glue hybrid connections
  • Antimass - Weightlessness effect that disjoins and floats objects
  • Consistency - Unalterable durability and fire resistance
  • Permanence - Infinite device lifetime
  • Self-Sufficiency - Battery-free operation
  • Autoflux - Automatic Flux activation state
  • Disanimation - Animation lock state

While some effects prove to be more advantageous than others, here is a list of the currently known UltraBroken Effects on individual Zonai Devices.

docs.text: UltraBroken Effects are not limited to the objects used in the following setups and they can be stacked, so feel free to experiment with any kind or number of objects and combine effects at whim.

docs.text:
As we delve deeper into the realm of UltraBroken Effects, we encounter the fascinating Antimass. If gravity is dampening the enjoyment, Antimass comes to the rescue, causing objects to float in mesmerizing weightless fashion and disjoining objects comprised of multiple parts.

By annihilating mass entirely, we can construct highly efficient and amusing UltraFuses when combined with Spooky Interactions. Provided they don't fly off into space.

docs.title: Ghost Glue
docs.text: Discovered by Duncan

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Ghost Glue is an exceptionally potent UltraBroken Effect and Spooky Interaction that enables us to establish connections between objects in unintended and eerie manners. It introduces the mechanics of Attraction, while simultaneously amplifying the significance of Zonai System Arrangement and Mass Matching.

Key Characteristics:

  • No Ultrahand Glue - Objects are held together by Attraction alone
  • Cannot be undone - Ghost Glue connections cannot be severed by conventional means
  • Stability depends on Mass Matching - The relative masses of objects determine connection strength
  • No Flux transfer - Ghost Glued Zonai Systems do not transfer Flux to one another
  • Doesn't count toward glue limit - Ghost Glue connections do not count towards the internal maximum glue connections counter

This effect is also known as "Duncan's Ghost Glue."

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Access to The Riverside Trolls
  • A Zonai Cart
  • A second Zonai Cart

docs.title: Procedure
docs.text:
1. Put a Zonai Cart in front of The Riverside Trolls
  2. Step on the Zonai Cart
  3. Talk to one of The Riverside Trolls
  4. Finish the dialogue
  5. Let the cutscene do its magic
  6. Find the Zonai Cart
  7. Check if the Zonai Cart is UltraBroken
  8. Put a second regular Zonai Cart next to the UltraBroken Zonai Cart
  9. Ghost Glue the UltraBroken Zonai Cart to the regular Zonai Cart

docs.title: Termination
docs.text:
• Put UltraBroken Equipment into the inventory without equipping it, put it on a mount or give it to the Break Apart shop to restore it
  • Put an object involved in a Spooky Interaction into the inventory to cancel it
  • Exceed the Distance Unload Radius of one object involved in a Spooky Interaction to cancel it
  • Trigger a dialogue or cutscene that deletes objects while an object involved in a Spooky Interaction is nearby to cancel it
  • Feed one object involved in a Spooky Interaction to a lifeform that devours objects to cancel it
  • Warp anywhere without performing Zuggle Load Object Transfer on both objects involved in a Spooky Interaction to cancel it
  • Transition into another map without performing Zuggle Load Object Transfer on both objects involved in a Spooky Interaction to cancel it
  • Load another save without performing Zuggle Load Object Transfer on both objects involved in a Spooky Interaction to cancel it

Related: See Mass Matching for understanding Ghost Glue connections, or Ghost Smuggle for advanced techniques.

docs.text:
If you've reached this point: Congratulations! You're halfway there, and now the fun part begins! Ghost Smuggling is an amusing technique that involves utilizing Ghost Glue between UltraBroken Equipment and various objects that can be glued together. From this stage onward, it becomes crucial to consider Mass Matching.

This technique is also commonly referred to as "Ghost Glue Smuggling".

docs.title: Lift Lock
docs.text: Discovered by NaN Gogh

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
There's a significant likelihood that you have encountered this rather disadvantageous UltraBroken Effect. Lift Locks render entire Zonai Systems, containing UltraBroken Objects, impossible to lift. The cause of this issue is remarkably easy to overlook and avoid, but rectifying it becomes considerably more challenging in intricate scenarios.

Key Information: Lift Locks will occur every time Link steps on a regular object that is part of a Zonai System containing an UltraBroken Object. Zonai Systems constructed with Ghost Glue, however, remain unaffected by this particular UltraBroken Effect.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Access to The Riverside Trolls
  • A Zonai Cart
  • A second Zonai Cart

docs.title: Procedure
docs.text:
1. Put a Zonai Cart in front of The Riverside Trolls
  2. Step on the Zonai Cart
  3. Talk to one of The Riverside Trolls
  4. Finish the dialogue
  5. Let the cutscene do its magic
  6. Find the Zonai Cart
  7. Check if the Zonai Cart is UltraBroken
  8. Glue a regular Zonai Cart to the UltraBroken Zonai Cart
  9. Step on the regular Zonai Cart
  10. Step back on the ground
  11. Ultrahand the regular Zonai Cart
  12. Apply directional pull

docs.title: The Fix
docs.text:
If you encounter a Lift Lock:

  1. Unglue the regular Zonai Cart from the UltraBroken Zonai Cart
  2. Glue the regular Zonai Cart back to the UltraBroken Zonai Cart
  3. Ultrahand the regular Zonai Cart
  4. Apply directional pull

  • Warp anywhere without performing Zuggle Load Object Transfer on the UltraBroken Object
  • Transition into another map without performing Zuggle Load Object Transfer on the UltraBroken Object
  • Load another save without performing Zuggle Load Object Transfer on the UltraBroken Object

docs.title: Mass Matching
docs.text: Discovered by The_Andromeda, Lafoscony, optimized by NaN Gogh

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
When attempting to establish a Ghost Glue connection between two objects, it is crucial to comprehend the mass properties of the objects involved and bear in mind a set of rules that determine whether the Ghost Glue connection will be loose or taut.

Weaker Ghost Glue connections are commonly referred to as "Puppet Glue" and "Puppet Smuggle".

docs.title: General Rules
docs.text:
• UltraBroken Objects with low mass have low Attraction to regular objects and UltraBroken Objects with low mass
  • UltraBroken Objects with high mass have high Attraction to regular objects and UltraBroken Objects with high mass
  • UltraBroken Objects with high mass have low Attraction to regular objects and UltraBroken Objects with low mass
  • The total net mass of all parts on each end of a Ghost Glue connection is crucial for its stability

docs.title: UltraBroken-Regular Interactions
docs.text:
• UltraBroken Objects with low mass have low Attraction to regular Objects with high mass
  • UltraBroken Objects with low mass have higher Attraction to regular Objects with low mass if those are Ultrahanded directly or indirectly
  • UltraBroken Objects with high mass have very high Attraction to regular Objects with low mass if those are Ultrahanded directly or indirectly

docs.title: UltraBroken-UltraBroken Interactions
docs.text:
• UltraBroken Objects with low mass have high Attraction to UltraBroken Objects with high mass
  • The Attraction between two UltraBroken Objects is higher when Ghost Glue comes from both sides

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Access to The Riverside Trolls
  • A Zonai Cart
  • Another Zonai Cart
  • A Material
  • Another Material

docs.title: Procedure
docs.text:
1. Put a Zonai Cart in front of The Riverside Trolls
  2. Glue a Material to the Zonai Cart
  3. Step on the Zonai Cart
  4. Talk to one of The Riverside Trolls
  5. Finish the dialogue
  6. Let the cutscene do its magic
  7. Find the Zonai Cart
  8. Check if the Zonai Cart is UltraBroken
  9. Detach the UltraBroken Zonai Cart from the UltraBroken Material
  10. Ghost Glue the UltraBroken Zonai Cart to the UltraBroken Material
  11. Glue a regular Material to the UltraBroken Material
  12. Move whole thing up and rotate it quickly using Ultrahand on the regular Material until the UltraBroken Zonai Cart falls off
  13. Ghost Glue the UltraBroken Material to the UltraBroken Zonai Cart
  14. Move whole thing up and rotate it quickly using Ultrahand on the regular Material
  15. Detach the regular Material
  16. Pick up the UltraBroken Material
  17. Put a regular Zonai Cart next to the UltraBroken Zonai Cart
  18. Ghost Glue the UltraBroken Zonai Cart to the regular Zonai Cart
  19. Put the regular Material on top of the UltraBroken Zonai Cart

docs.title: Quantum State Freeze

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Quantum State Freeze encompasses a diverse range of chilling UltraBroken Effects. Consequently, the individual effects it exerts on objects will be collectively known as Quantum State Freeze Effects.

docs.title: Consistency (Dura Freeze)
docs.text:
Consistency encompasses a series of powerful Quantum State Freeze Effects:

  • Unalterable durability - Durability of UltraBroken Bows, UltraBroken Shields, and specific fuses on UltraBroken Weapons cannot decrease over time
  • Boss-proof - UltraBroken Objects can withstand shockwaves from Lynels and Bosses, effectively transforming them into perfect traps
  • Flame resistance - Wooden UltraBroken Objects with Consistency cannot be consumed by flames and will remain perpetually ablaze
  • Destructible shells - Destructible UltraBroken Materials can be destroyed, leaving behind an empty yet functional shell
  • ChuChu Alchemy - ChuChu Jellies cannot be transmuted, allowing Green ChuChu Jellies, for example, to burn indefinitely

docs.title: Permanence
docs.text: Zonai Devices possess inherent lifetimes of approximately 15 minutes, their countdown clock constantly ticking away. However, the Quantum State Freeze Effect Permanence has the power to halt this timer. With permanent UltraBroken Zonai Devices, you can rely on their unwavering functionality throughout extended sessions without the fear of their lifespan expiring.

docs.title: Self-Sufficiency
docs.text:
Among the intriguing Quantum State Freeze Effects associated with UltraBroken Zonai Devices, one stands out prominently: Self-Sufficiency. UltraBroken Zonai Devices possess the remarkable ability to operate without draining batteries whatsoever, rendering them self-sustaining in this regard.

Furthermore, there exist specific Zonai Devices that go even further, supplying infinite amounts of Flux to connected Zonai Systems, amplifying their functionality indefinitely.

docs.title: Autoflux
docs.text:
Another intriguing Quantum State Freeze Effect observed in UltraBroken Zonai Devices is Autoflux. It exhibits variation among individual devices, with some permanently activated and others permanently deactivated.

The activation state of UltraBroken Zonai Devices becomes fixed and cannot be toggled anymore. Moreover, certain devices even transmit their erratic Autoflux behavior to connected Zonai Devices, further complicating their interactions.

docs.title: Disanimation
docs.text: Numerous UltraBroken Zonai Devices exhibiting this effect remain locked in the animation they were in when UltraBroken was performed on them. Some animations leave Zonai Devices not working properly after UltraBroken has been performed on them while those animations were playing.

docs.title: UltraBroken: The Core Mechanic
docs.text: Welcome to the foundation of the UltraBroken phenomenon. This section covers everything you need to understand the core mechanic before exploring its effects.

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• Introduction - What is UltraBroken?
  • Zorona & Kairo - Meet the Riverside Trolls
  • Etymology - How it got its name
  • Requirements - What you need to trigger it
  • Procedure - Step-by-step setup (works 99% of the time)
  • Exceptions - Objects that don't break
  • Attributes - How to identify UltraBroken objects
  • Theories - Technical speculation
  • Datamine - The root cause explained

Next: Read Introduction to get started!

docs.title: How to Identify Them
docs.text: UltraBroken Objects can be easily identified through the use of the Ultrahand ability. Both visual and gameplay-related characteristics serve as indicators.

docs.title: Visual Indicators
docs.text:
• No highlighting when pointed at - UltraBroken Objects have no highlighting when pointed at with Ultrahand
  • Triforce Gold - Ghost Green highlighting - When Ultrahanded, they toggle that highlighting for all connected objects
  • Ghost Green highlighting with Stake - UltraBroken Objects have a Ghost Green highlighting if ultrahanded while a Stake is attached to them

docs.title: Gameplay Characteristics
docs.text:
• Cannot be Recalled - The Recall ability has no effect
  • Cannot be snapped to Autobuild Holograms - Snapping is disabled
  • Cannot be moved directly using Ultrahand - Standard Ultrahand movement doesn't work (but pulling with attached objects does)
  • Cannot be glued to other objects regularly - Normal gluing is impossible (but Ghost Glue works!)
  • Extreme mass or friction - Most UltraBroken Objects appear to have either extremely high mass or friction attributes

These attributes make UltraBroken objects unique and are the foundation for the various effects described in the Effects section.

Next: Explore Theories about how this works, or jump to Effects.

docs.title: What the Code Reveals
docs.text:
MrCheeze managed to uncover the cause of UltraBroken within the game's code. It appears that during The Riverside Trolls' dialogue, there is a boolean variable named IsAwaitEnd that is inexplicably set to false.

Subsequently, a mod was developed to set this boolean to true, effectively resolving the UltraBroken issue. It's worth noting that this incorrectly set boolean is completely unparalleled throughout the entire game thus far.

docs.title: The Code Snippet
docs.text:
Here is the code snippet where the magic occurs:

GameSystemActor.EventClearActorsAnchor(
    {
        'IsSweepOut': True,
        'AnchorActorName': 'DestinationActor',
        'AnchorInstanceName': 'LinkWarp_AfterZoronaEvent',
        'Radius': 5.0,
        'Height': 4.0,
        'IsDeleteActor': True,
        'IsExcludePlacedAroundAnchor': False,
        'IsWaitEnd': False  # <-- THE BUG!
    }
)

The IsWaitEnd being set to False instead of True causes the system to fail to properly wait for the end of the anchor clearing sequence, leaving objects in a broken state.

Now that you understand the core mechanic, explore the Effects!

docs.title: Objects That Refuse to Break
docs.text:
There is one specific object that refuses to be UltraBroken:

  • The Stake - Cannot be made UltraBroken through the standard procedure

docs.title: Protection Methods
docs.text:
It is possible to protect objects from being UltraBroken by:

  • Fuse-entangling them - Apply a fuse to the object
  • Keeping the shields they are fuse-entangled to out of the process - Don't place fused shields in front of the Riverside Trolls

This allows you to selectively preserve certain items while breaking others in the same setup.

Next: Understand how to Identify UltraBroken Objects and their unique properties.

docs.title: What Is UltraBroken?
docs.text:
Join me as we delve into the depths of insanity with The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom's undoubtedly most broken glitch. But this isn't just a glitch actually; it's a revered gem among all glitches; a true holy grail—a developer oversight!

UltraBroken unleashes a multitude of effects on the game, enhancing the already stellar gameplay and ultimately leading to the discovery of UltraFuses. However, it's important to note that this glitch only works on game versions prior to 1.2 and comes with its own set of sacrifices.

docs.title: Zorona and Kairo
docs.text:
These two individuals seem to be perpetually lost while wandering around Hyrule. You may encounter them at various points during the main questline. They are frequently engaged in discussions about how to navigate and reach specific locations within Hyrule. Interestingly enough, one of them, a Goron, sports remarkably Ghost-Green underwear.

For the purposes of this document, we'll refer to them as The Riverside Trolls, owing to their hilariously absurd and mind-boggling antics that take place at Riverside Stable.

docs.title: Etymology
docs.text:
Duncan was the one who initially christened it on 05.29.2023, and after a poll, it was officially named "Wacko Boingo." "Wacko" was chosen to capture its essence of wildness and unpredictability, while "Boingo" was selected because, besides the underlying code that triggers it, its actual functionality remains a mystery.

As research progressed and more UltraBroken Effects came to light, a collective discussion prompted Duncan to reconsider the name, opting for a more mature-sounding alternative that reflected our growing understanding of it. And thus, UltraBroken, as we now know it, was born.

Next: Learn the Requirements to trigger UltraBroken.

docs.title: Basic Setup (99% Success Rate)
docs.text: The fundamental process of UltraBroken is relatively straightforward and efficient. If you bear with me, we will encounter variations of this setup numerous times. The intricacies arise later on with UltraFuses. The following setup works in 99% of the time.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Put any object you can stand on and use Ultrahand on in front of the Riverside Trolls
  2. Step on the object directly or indirectly
  3. Talk to one of the two NPCs
  4. Finish the dialogue
  5. Let the cutscene run
  6. DO NOT HARD SAVE!!! - Transfer your stuff to the past (using ZLOT or Zuggle)

docs.title: What Happens?
docs.text:
The object you placed will become UltraBroken, gaining special properties and unlocking a vast array of effects and interactions.

Next: Learn what Exceptions exist and what Attributes UltraBroken objects have.

docs.title: Requirements to Trigger UltraBroken
docs.text: Flash successfully pinpointed the precise conditions that trigger the appearance of Zorona and Kairo at Riverside Stable. This specific occurrence provides the sole opportunity for them to execute UltraBroken. Once it is set up, there are ways to conserve the moment in time forever.

docs.title: What You Need
docs.text:
1. Wind Temple or Fire Temple finished - Complete at least one of these main dungeons
  2. Zorona and Kairo met at Lookout Landing - You must have encountered them at the lookout first

Once these conditions are met, you can head to Riverside Stable and begin the UltraBroken process.

Next: Follow the Procedure to execute the glitch.

docs.title: Technical Speculation
docs.text:
During the golden era of Wacko Boingo, there has been extensive speculation and analysis taking place. One theory proposes that the cutscene contains a malfunctioning positional mechanism that interrupts the progression of object states, causing them to abruptly plummet to the ground with a mass exceeding the lifting capacity of the Ultrahand.

Feel free to challenge this hypothesis! The community continues to develop new theories as our understanding grows.

Next: See the Datamine to learn what the code actually reveals.
